com.github.dm.jrt.channel

Interface TransportChannel<DATA>

  • Type Parameters:
    DATA - the data type.
    All Superinterfaces:
    Channel, InputChannel<DATA>, Iterable<DATA>, Iterator<DATA>, OutputChannel<DATA>

    public interface TransportChannel<DATA>
extends InputChannel<DATA>, OutputChannel<DATA>
    Interface defining a transport channel.

    A transport channel is useful to make other asynchronous tasks communicate with a routine.
    The channel output can be passed to a routine input channel in order to feed it with data coming asynchronously from other sources. Note however that, in any case, the close() method must be called in order to correctly terminate the invocation lifecycle.

    Created by davide-maestroni on 10/25/2014.

    • Method Detail

      • after

        @Nonnull
TransportChannel<DATA> after(@Nonnull
                                   TimeDuration delay)
        Tells the channel to delay the transfer of data of the specified time duration.
        Note that an abortion command will be delayed as well. Note, however, that a delayed abortion will not prevent the invocation from completing, as input data do.
        Specified by:
        after in interface InputChannel<DATA>
        Parameters:
        delay - the delay.
        Returns:
        this channel.

      • orderByCall

        @Nonnull
TransportChannel<DATA> orderByCall()
        Tells the channel to sort the passed input data based on the order of the calls to the pass methods.

        By default no particular order is applied.

        Specified by:
        orderByCall in interface InputChannel<DATA>
        Returns:
        this channel.
        See Also:
        InputChannel.orderByChance(), InputChannel.orderByDelay()

      • orderByChance

        @Nonnull
TransportChannel<DATA> orderByChance()
        Tells the channel to avoid sorting the passed input in any particular order.

        This is the default behavior.

        Specified by:
        orderByChance in interface InputChannel<DATA>
        Returns:
        this channel.
        See Also:
        InputChannel.orderByCall(), InputChannel.orderByDelay()

      • orderByDelay

        @Nonnull
TransportChannel<DATA> orderByDelay()
        Tells the channel to sort the passed input data based on the specific delay.
        Note that only the inputs passed with a 0 delay will be delivered in the same order as they are passed to the channel, while the others will be delivered as soon as the dedicated runner handles the specific execution.

        By default no particular order is applied.

        Specified by:
        orderByDelay in interface InputChannel<DATA>
        Returns:
        this channel.
        See Also:
        InputChannel.orderByCall(), InputChannel.orderByChance()

      • pass

        @Nonnull
TransportChannel<DATA> pass(@Nullable
                                  OutputChannel<? extends DATA> channel)
        Passes the data returned by the specified channel to this one.

        Note that the output channel will be bound as a result of the call, thus effectively preventing any other consumer from getting data from it.

        Specified by:
        pass in interface InputChannel<DATA>
        Parameters:
        channel - the output channel.
        Returns:
        this channel.
        See Also:
        OutputChannel.passTo(InputChannel)

      • afterMax

        @Nonnull
TransportChannel<DATA> afterMax(@Nonnull
                                      TimeDuration timeout)
        Tells the channel to wait at the max the specified time duration for the next result to be available.

        By default the timeout is set to 0 to avoid unexpected deadlocks.

        Specified by:
        afterMax in interface OutputChannel<DATA>
        Parameters:
        timeout - the maximum timeout.
        Returns:
        this channel.

TransportChannel<DATA> eventuallyAbort()

      • passTo

        @Nonnull
TransportChannel<DATA> passTo(@Nonnull
                                    OutputConsumer<? super DATA> consumer)
        Binds this channel to the specified consumer. After the call, all the output will be passed only to the consumer. Attempting to read through the dedicated methods will cause an IllegalStateException to be thrown.
        Note that the consumer methods will be called on the runner thread.
        Specified by:
        passTo in interface OutputChannel<DATA>
        Parameters:
        consumer - the consumer instance.
        Returns:
        this channel.

OutputChannel<DATA> asOutput()

        Returns:
        this channel.

      • close

        @Nonnull
TransportChannel<DATA> close()
        Closes the channel input.
        If the channel is already closed, this method has no effect.

        Note that this method must be always called when done with the channel.

        Returns:
        this channel.
